name: Tap Tap Infinity
description: Tap Tap Infinity is a fully 3D incremental RPG. Hire Heroes to fight for you, even with the game closed! Gain unimaginable DPS, mountains of gold, conquer thousands of levels and millions of monsters on your quest to defeat ‘The Master'.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 or 8 Processor: 1Ghz or faster processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: At least it CAN be finished...  I've played some clickers up to this moment, and I can admit, Tap Tap Infinity is not the most original, or breath-catching of them. In fact, I even agree with the point that it looks so much like 'Cliker Heroes' title. Only better.  Let's just say about clickers in general: they are little games with tendency to keep on going, like, forever. The good side of those games, as I see it, is that you can leave the clicker game going, and even close the game window, and yet it will be playing - for you. All clicker games are about numbers - you starting with 1 coin, then, after 1 hour, you're operating millions, then you learning about googoles... and bigger numbers. At some point, I bet, the Graham number can be achieved through some clicker game...  So! As I thought when first started some clickers, the process is easy enough - you start the game, making first moves (clicks), and then you go to your business, and the game running itself forward, making some achievements with numbers on its way. Funny thing, but only Tap Tap Infinity was good enough in that. All other clickers after some point getting more and more deserving for your time, to the point where you'll be mindlessly clicking the mouse all day long. All - but not Tap Tap Infinity! Yeah, despite the name. Getting controversial here... With some latest addons, it become one of the most fanciest clickers I've met. It is more stable, and more fair than 'Clicker Heroes', where you just can't beat the latest levels normally. All big numbers are messed up in your precious 'Clicker Heroes', dear fans, and I really can't even feel sorrow for you, if you still climbing to the upper levels, but not able to achieve them!  Okay, let's summarise: Tap Tap Infinity is your standard clicker game, one of those which I actually can recommend to play if you're wandering what's it is all about. Although if you want all 100 achievements, be prepared to spend dozens of hours on that (I was playing offline mostly, so don't think it is as fast as 14 hours to beat the game). And, besides time, which is still more precious than all those clicker games, to start with... If you still want to try a piece, don't play it with your best mouse (the one which is worth more than 10$). Clicker games are made for killing touchscreens and mouses, keep that in mind.  My mark will be 6/10. Almost a normal game, and free-ware! But really, better play something more mind-catching.

TL;DR: Grindy but truly casual clicker game for those who want to play while they play.    Tap Tap Infinity  is a casual idle/clicker game, very similar to a certain other Steam game,  Clicker Heroes  (CH). Now why would a gamer like me with several thousand games (some of which might actually be good) waste time to play this? For achievements of course.  Now that my lousy motivation is out of the way, let's get dirty with the details. Being a clicker game the gameplay itself isn't very complex. A monster appears on the screen. Clicking it will damage it. Once it gets enough damage it dies and bleeds gold, with which you can buy upgrades and train your heroes to be able to beat higher, more difficult monster waves.   A game with a story
Only been playing this game for 4 days it is addictive :) Much better than clicker heroes personally. Would Definatly recommend it :D

- It's just like Clicker Heroes, but I like it more. You need to defeat the Bosses, to unlock and buy them and their skills. You unlock your spells by ranking up and you can also upgrade them, like same as you can upgrade your Heroes Skills. Great game, that you can play hundred hours and you still have something to improve. Also I love Mystery Gifts, which you drops really often and you can win Ranks, golds or Infinity Tokens. - Great game for a lot of time. I hope, developers will add more heroes (After 500 level or something like that) and will keep updating this game with more locations, monsters and spells. - You can also play it on Phones !
ap Infinity

Purchases of new hero's to work for you and then up to upgrade .  It's quite a nice spl to run in the background. Or too quickly in between by doing . It is normally a game that you often find on your mobile phone .  Find it is not the best version of this species. But own the most beautiful. Most of these games all look a bit alike.  I prefure Clicker Heroes because of the option ingame like clan wars.  I give this game a 6/10 score.

Tap Tap Infinity is the best clicker/idle game on the market. The cloud save feature lets you play your game across all of your devices, without interruption. This alone puts it above all other games of its type. The gameplay is well-paced. The graphics are also quite good. Scary Bee has put in a huge amount of effort into this game and it shows.  10AE out of 10^2 - would repetitive stress injury again!

First i need to say is that i 'played' the game for over 19 hours (sleeping included) to level 245 (look at my achivements if you don´t trust it!). I still don´t recomment such 'idle-games' because all of them are boring. The diffrences from this game to clickerheroes are unimportant, because new features like story (the story is bad and you need to click it away so it feel more like crap) or max buy (who cares it with autoclicker?!) and all the other new features make it not a new game. I don´t know how to have fun with such 'games' so... if you have fun with other idlegames play this but the diffrences between this and clickerheroes are unimportant as i said. And don´t be so stupid like other guys and use your mouse for clicking like an idiot. Use an autoclicker that click for you because this games are designed for it and it´s not worth to bring your mouse and your fingers/hand to the limit (tenosynovitis isn´t funny!!!).  If you think like me that this 'games' are a !!!BIG PIECE OF BULL...äh...CRAP!!! then go and play real games from your libary.  Btw. the reason to write such reviews is that this 'games' are terrible overrated. To avoid it is like to assist the system to scam peoples money with microtransactions.

ok this mybe a spin of off clicker heroes or a bull copy. but dont forget about cookie clicker was the real thing any ways about the game  this game is ok the 3D was a bomb and something i dident like but i well still play this but more of heroes clicker  5/10
Adds nothing to the genre.

My personal experience with this game is, even if I have not played it for too long is that it's way to much like clicker heroes, no wait, hear me out, I have been a die hard fan of cookie clicker, and played that for a couple of years, and then came clicker heroes, which uses a similiar but different formula making it feel a bit fresher (although by now I don't even spend much time in clicker heroes other than bying heroes trying to get all achivements before I can quit). and here come tap tap infinity. A game which is exactly like clicker heroes, save some differences but not enough of them to make me feel like it's something fresh and new, but more like ah, I have done this before, boss at every fifth?, hp instead of timers but the same deal (this is not fresh), and so I played and hoped for something new but no, gold, chests, heroes, hero abilities, % , 'spells' and of the few I got is basicly the same as the ones in clicker heroes.  although the graphics are in 3d and the bosses are your future heroes, with including text boxes everywhere trying to create a story by making you clicking to get the story to move on (which halts gameplay), ofc it's all according to your taste. I choose CH because that's the one I begun with, and I hate the blantant ripping I have seen in TTI I must admit. someone should just come up with a new formula instead.
Lots of clicks

This game is a Hero Clicker clone with clicking and idling to get more money. Compared to this genre standard there are some more options like there are actually two types of ascension. We have 4 'ancients' with four abilities already unlocked. Graphics are better though the flavor text is somewhat boring in comparison.  There is some kind of story in there but not too much I guess. Big bonus is the cloud save so you can also play on your mobile phone.  TLDR; if you like idle games or Hero Clicker you can grab this one also.

No Just no I have play Adventure capitalist and Clicker Heroes And I not going to put no more time in tho kind of game's I am burnout of them For now lol Anyway Clicker Heroes and this game look to close a like :D And That why I Am Giveing it a Thumb Down... this game is to alike Clicker Heroes come to steam First so yeah..... :D

I though I would try this out. I knew I would have to use my mouse but I did not prepare to change my mouse or its batteries while playing this game.   Yea I know its tapping over and over and over till your hand is sore and you shoulder feels like it gonna fall off form burning due to the fact that you tapped till you couldnt tap no more.  I guess if you dont mind tapping or have other people or even kids that can help you out and enjoy just pushing the mouse buttons then this game is for you!   Other than the burning in my fingers to my shoulder it could be a fun game.

It's basically cookie clicker wearing an RPG costume.   The gameplay is the same as cookie clicker. You click 'a cookie' to earn 'cookies' to help buy other things that will help you make more 'cookies' faster. However in this case, you click RPG style enemies to attack them, earn currency and use this currency to enslave (or as the game puts it, hire) the bosses that you murder and spend more money on leveling up those slaves and making them more efficient at killing future slaves. You can even go back and kill the bosses you've already enslaved! Trust me, it's actually really simple.  The art style is very cartoon-like and it is technically 3D. The enemy models are simple, but they still look really nice and slick. The game runs smoothly, without any frame drops and all the animations are also smooth and well made.  If you liked cookie clicker, and like RPG's you will LOVE this game. Even if you don't like cookie clicker, give this game a shot, because it's free and takes 30 seconds to download. What have you got to lose?
clicker heroes was the end. THIS is the new beginning.
Awesome. Can't stop playing.
i was on level 107 and then i delletet the game
Good game, a bit like Clicker Heroes but unique in its own way.

Aside from visuals, this game is not significantly different from any other 'idle' game you've seen before. Kill things, level up, unlock people to fight for you, eventually reset the whole thing and start over endlessly. Upgrades are there, but like all of these idle games they're either going to take you weeks to get anywhere significant, or you're going to end up paying for them. I can't even call this a 'pay to win' model because you never actually win. The game goes on forever. So this and most other idle games become a test of your patience. Are you willing to wait several hours or several days for that next tantalizing upgrade, or will the game convince you to spend your hard-earned cash?  I suppose it's good enough to kill a random few minutes here and there, so long as you don't get too invested in it. That said, there's really not much in the way of gameplay. You click things. You're never in any danger and there's no real risk. You just sit there and click things. All of these games eventually get boring because you're just rehashing the same thing over and over again. It wouldn't be so bad if they weren't all so similar.

Hmm, what can i say that haven't been said already.... -_- I... it's a.... cool game. Yeah! ^^ That will work, cool game, free, simple, 3D models makes it more fun, the idle mode is great, Infinite is a new, interesting feature, I know i don't have that many hours on this game yet to make a full review of it, but hell, one that got over 200 hours on Sakura Clicker, this is a nice change. :D I like this game, gonna stick with it a long time i think.

Simple . fun . catchy tune . can be played minutes at a time or for hours on end . has offline auto progress . power up game to check your progress , level up your heroes then walk away or close game :) .  clicking optional if you want to . critical clicks can decimate enemies .
This game is just as much fun as the last time I played it when it was called Clicker Heroes.

Love the game, though it has reset my game 3 times now... and the cloud won't allow me to login to pickup my sve... this most recent time has raged me... not entirely sure if i will pick it back up...

I only dislike the fact that I can kill 10,000 monsters over 4 days idle, and it only gives me one rank when I only need 800/1000 monsters to rank up.
I this its a fun game. The best part of Tap Tap Inifity is that it syncs between IOS devices effortlessly with the steam version! This to me, is a must.

It is honestly a waste of time... It's just clicking, I will need a new mouse afterwards. Good thing it you can close it and leave it for weeks for your heros things to farm some coins--Makes it faster to upgrade them.  It will get boring over time just like most clicker games. It could be better could be worse, I think this is probably one of the better tapping games becasue of the options available and such.
Cookie Clicker, but 3D, on Steam, no ads, and with an actual storyline.  9/10, this game can get boring after a while.
Interface and gameplay are both not as good as Crusaders of the Lost Idols or Time Clickers.

This game is basically your typical clicker game. I do have to say, though, that it is able to stand our from others quite well. It has a very basic story which, even despite its simplicity, I can appreciate. It's 3D, which makes the game look a lot more unique from most of the other 2D clicker games.  Only complaint is the music, which is a very short loop, gets repetitive VERY fast and can be annoying to listen to. So, in conclusion, if you're looking for a few hours to kill I suggest trying this one out.
Let the clicking begin!
